brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine how frequently children undergoing elective
      neurosurgical procedures develop blood clots in the deep veins of the legs while
      hospitalized. The information gained from this study will help us determine when children
      children need to receive therapy to help prevent this type of blood clot from forming.

clinical_study.brief_title: Incidence of Venous Thromboembolism in Children Undergoing Elective Neurosurgical Procedures

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients age 1 month-12 years undergoing elective neurosurgical procedures.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients undergoing outpatient neurosurgical procedures

          -  Patients with know DVT

          -  Patients with known hypercoagulable state

          -  Patients at high risk for DVT (discretion of surgeon in consultation with the
             hematology service)

study_pop.textblock:
100 children between the ages of 1 month-12 years having an elective neurosurgical
        procedure and James Whitcomb Riley Hospital for Children.

facility.name: James Whitcomb Riley Hospital for Children

clinical_study.official_title: Incidence of Venous Thromboembolism in Children Undergoing Elective Neurosurgical Procedures

oversight_info.authority: USA: Indiana University Institutional Review Board

primary_outcome.description: No DVT prophylaxis will be provided during surgery. Bilateral lower extremity Doppler ultrasounds are obtained within 48 hours pre-operatively.  Doppler ultrasound studies will then be performed within 72 hours after the surgery.  The studies will be evaluated by a board-certified radiologist.
primary_outcome.time_frame: ultrasound 48 hours prior to surgery and 72 hours after surgery

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
